brief_summary.textblock:
Pirfenidone as anti-fibrosis drug developed in recent years demonstrated the potential anti-
      fibrotic effect, but so far there were no domestic studies  about pirfenidone's efficacy and
      safety evaluation in china. The aim of this study was to evaluate the efficacy and safety of
      pirfenidone in patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) through the observation of
      a large sample of clinical cases.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Efficacy and Safety of Pirfenidone in Patients With Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis

detailed_description.textblock:
The aim of this study was to evaluate the efficacy and safety of pirfenidone in patients
      with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) through the observation of a large sample of
      clinical cases. During the observation, study visits will occur at the end of 12w, 24w, 36w,
      48w.all participants will be required to check the various efficacy and safety indicators.

intervention.description: Pirfenidone（200mg）tablets will be taken two tablets 3 times a day during the whole study process.
placebo will be taken two tablets 3 times a day during the whole study process

clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Trial for Clinical Efficacy and Safety of Pirfenidone in Patients With Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis

primary_outcome.description: to evaluate changes in FVC  from baseline to 12 weeks /24 weeks/36 weeks/48 weeks

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Lung function will be measured as improved/stabilized/exacerbated from baseline to 12 weeks/24 weeks/36 weeks/48 weeks
secondary_outcome.measure: changes in lung function (including Forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) and The differences of diffusing capacity of the lung for carbon monoxide (DLco) )

secondary_outcome.description: Changes in 6 minute walk distance (6MWD) and  from baseline to 12/24/36/48weeks

Life quality will be assessed as improved if SGRQ single or total score increased >4% when completing the trial; Life quality will be assessed as stabilized if SGRQ single or total score changes within the range of 4% when completing the trial; Life quality will be assessed as exacerbated if SGRQ single or total score decreased >4% when completing the trial.
secondary_outcome.measure: Life quality: assessed by St. George respiratory questionnaire (SGRQ).

secondary_outcome.description: to measure  rating dyspnea according by Medi Medical Research Center(MMRC)
secondary_outcome.measure: Dyspnea score according by Modified Medical Research Center(MMRC)
